1 Sexual Harassment

Which of the following statements about sexual harassment is FALSE?
The EEOC has set two basic requirements for sexual harassment. The conduct in question must be
Which of the following statements about sexual harassment is TRUE?
If an employee is not comfortable with the workplace harassment complaint procedure, they have the right to talk/report to

Officer Jones is a white, male correctional officer. During his rounds, he accidentally overhears three other white male officers telling racial jokes about white guys. Could this activity be considered a violation of the D.C.S.O. workplace harassment policy?

Metro Government abides by all employment regulations set forth by Title VII, but of the following which is not a “protected category” according to Metro Ordinance# BL2009-502 that prohibits discrimination?

Sgt. Lightyear is a supervisor. He has taken a romantic interest in Officer Williams. He has asked her to date him and made numerous sexually suggestive comments. She asked him to stop, but has not filed a complaint. The behavior hasn’t stopped. To whom should Officer Williams report this behavior?

1 Staff Inmate Relations & Ethical Conduct

What is your responsibility if you witness an unethical violation in the workplace?

Lt. Rock calls Officer Pebble into his office and hands her a poem. The poem reads, “Your eyes are as blue as the deepest ocean. Place your uniform in the nearest chair and we’ll talk about your promotion.” Which of the following items does this activity represent?
An employee who is arrested or cited for criminal conduct in any jurisdiction

2 Communication Skills
_________ is the foundation which all characteristics, skills, and abilities are based.
Listening involves
For professional communication to be successful it is important that you

Listeners will believe a statement only about 7%-10% based upon what is said and the rest is based upon other non-verbal communication. That is, for communication to be effective, what you say must match how you say it. This concept is known as:
Characteristics of a professional are:

It is important to conduct yourself professionally because many times the inmate will take their cue from you. For example; if you are calm and respectful the inmate will likely be better behaved as well.

3 Staff Inmate Relations

You approach Officer Jackson who tells you that there is no inappropriate conduct occurring between her and Inmate Jones. You handle this incident by:

4 Subject Control

4 Tactical Communication

The mode of operation that gives the initial officer direct communicative responsibilities and the other officer observation and intervention responsibilities is called:

Correctional Officers should try to verbally de-escalate most situations. However, D.O.N.E. represents the concept of when words fail or when it is time to act. D.O.N.E. stands for Danger, Overriding Concern, __________, Escape.

With “back up” in place, Officer Fife asked, “Is there anything I can say or do to gain your compliance?” Inmate Pyle angrily responded, “Why don’t you KISS my naked, non-compliant A**!” Officer Fife then proceeded to spray Inmate Pyle with Freeze + P. Poor maintenance inspections can lead to inmate escapes.

5 Use of Force

An offender is fully secured in the restraint chair. As the nurse attempts to check the offender’s restraints, the offender grabs her wrist with his restrained hand and tries to bite her. You are authorized to spray the offender with your chemical agent to stop the offender’s behavior.

An offender is fully secured in the restraint chair. As the nurse attempts to check the offender’s restraints, he head butts her. You are authorized to spray the offender with your chemical agent to stop the offender’s behavior.
